metadata.title: CVE-2017-5592 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An incorrect implementation of "XEP-0280: Message Carbons" in multiple XMPP clients allows a remote attacker to impersonate any user, including contacts, in the vulnerable application's display. This allows for various kinds of social engineering attacks. This CVE is for profanity (0.4.7 - 0.5.0).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-5592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

profanity - 0.5.1-3
profanity-light - 0.5.1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: profanity package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.5.1-3').
